Educational resources for students

This page is to support students and colleagues of Derek Groen (http://people.brunel.ac.uk/~csstddg) with reference material. It will contain selected material from http://www.github.com/djgroen/student-resources.

Where to begin

  • Go through the tutorials in the ‘Essential Learning Resources’ section to build your foundational knowledge. Some sections may be more suited for students than colleagues.

  • ‘Legacy Tutorials’ contains material that are no longer actively maintained or updated, it may be useful for anyone looking to deepen their knowledge in certain fields.

  • To learn about my work on FabSim3, click the link to its ReadTheDocs page.

  • Onboarding and Orientation
    • Overview of Team Structure
    • Introduction to Simulation Projects
    • Getting Started with Project Documentation
    • Expectations for Students
  • Software Tools and Setup

    • Version Control with Git and GitHub
    • Common Git Issues and Fixes
  • Communication and Collaboration
    • How to Use Communication Tools
    • Best Practices for Code Reviews
    • Writing Effective Documentation
    • Working with a Mentor
  • Basics of Task Management
    • Defining tasks
    • Which tasks to discuss in meetings
    • Dealing with complications and delays
    • Signs something is wrong with your task list
    • Signs something is wrong with your task definition
    • Task management platforms
    • Resources for time management
  • Tips for Dissertation Writing
    • Quantifying contributions
    • Writing the individual contributions
    • Writing
    • Presenting designs
    • Self reflections
    • Learning outcomes
    • FYP Dissertation Template
    • Writing an Introduction
    • Common Thesis Problems
  • Software Engineering Basics and Good Practices
    • How to report technical problems
    • Writing Unit Tests
  • Designing and prototyping your own simulation with Python3.
    • Requirements

    • Rules for movement and state changes
    • From state to simulation
    • installing dependencies
    • Main visualization
